timeline.summary: Martin G. Weinberg contacted Marty [REDACTED] regarding a Petition to Probate the Jeffrey Epstein Estate and Will, which was filed in the Virgin Islands on August 16, 2019. Weinberg requested a copy of the petition from [REDACTED] or someone who could provide it.

On August 17, 2019, Martin G. Weinberg informed [REDACTED] of a Petition to Probate the Epstein Estate and Will filed in the Virgin Islands. The filing occurred following a telephone conversation where [REDACTED] requested information about the estate’s status. Weinberg noted that he did not find a publicly filed petition, though he acknowledged the possibility of it being located elsewhere.

An automatic reply email was sent from the Epstein Estate Touhy regarding a request, dated August 20, 2019, indicating the sender was in Dallas for depositions through August 23, 2019, and another individual was covering for them. The email references case file EFTA00030966.

An email chain discusses the Epstein Estate Touhy requests. One sender, from Texas and with a childhood memory gap, expresses interest in potentially assisting. Another sender recommends visiting the JFK museum. A third sender confirms being in Dallas for depositions through August 23, 2019.

The motion argues for an expedited program administered by independent experts (Jordana Feldman, Kenneth Feinberg, and Camille Biros) to resolve claims efficiently and with sensitivity to claimants’ experiences. Key points: *   **Multiple Lawsuits:** Twelve lawsuits involving sexual abuse claims have been filed against the estate, primarily in New York. *   **Claims Resolution Program:** The Co-Executors propose a confidential, non-adversarial program to provide claimants with compensation, aiming to avoid protracted litigation. *   **Expert Administration:** The program would be managed by the named experts, leveraging their experience with similar mass tort programs (September 11th Victim Compensation Fund, etc.). *   **Request for Authorization:** The Co-Executors request court authorization to fund the program’s administration by retaining the experts’ services. *   **Strategic Rationale:** The motion emphasizes the benefits of the program including reducing litigation costs, providing timely resolution, and demonstrating a commitment to fair compensation. Essentially, the Co-Executors are seeking a structured, expert-led process to manage the complex and potentially costly claims arising from the estate.

An event titled “Epstein estate” took place on October 23, 2019, from 6:30 PM to 7:00 PM GMT. Marc A. Weinstein (redacted) organized the event via a Skype meeting with Conference ID 803 102 52. Attendees included Tomback, Andrew (redacted). A reminder was set to display 15 minutes before the start, including dial-in numbers for various countries: Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Singapore, United Kingdom, United States. The document also provides instructions for joining the meeting via computer or mobile device, and offers troubleshooting steps via Skype Web App and the “Help” link. Additionally, it includes a dial-in PIN for a specific number (+12016300824).
An email was sent from “)” to “Weinstein, Marc A.” on October 23, 2019, regarding a tentative Epstein estate. The email included an unnamed attachment.

On October 23, 2019, at 6:30 PM GMT, Marc Weinstein (with a redacted attendee) participated in a Skype meeting classified as X-PERSONAL regarding the Epstein estate. The meeting was created on October 23, 2019, at 1:47 PM GMT and has a priority level of 5.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on October 23, 2019, regarding the “Accepted: Epstein estate counsel call” with the subject “EFTA00025255”. There were two redactions on page 1 of the document.
An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding the acceptance of a call from the Epstein estate counsel. The email was dated October 23, 2019, and referenced document EFTA00024294.

On October 23, 2019, at 6:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein and the Epstein estate. The meeting was classified as X-PERSONAL. The meeting was created on October 23, 2019, at 1:34 PM GMT and has a DTSTAMP of 1:20 PM GMT.

On 2019-10-30 at 18:30:00 +0000, there was an accepted call with the Epstein estate counsel (EFTA00025256). The call lasted from 18:30:00 to 19:00:00 +0000. The event was classified as X-PERSONAL, created on 2019-10-23, and had a priority of 5.

On October 30, 2019, at 6:30 PM GMT, a call occurred between Epstein estate counsel and an unidentified party (Class: X-PERSONAL). The event was created on October 23, 2019, with a priority of 5. A reminder was set to display a message 15 minutes before the start time. The record is designated EFTA00028834.

Marc Weinstein sent an email to Andrew Tomback regarding the Epstein estate. The email included dial-in numbers for various countries and provided instructions for joining a Skype for Business meeting, differentiating between meetings with presentations/video and those without. The email also offered assistance for first-time users joining the meeting from a computer. The document is identified as EFTA00024296.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Birch contacted Andrew Tomback of White & Case on November 25, 2019, regarding a call related to the Epstein estate. The communication included dial-in numbers for international participants, categorized by country and region, and instructions for joining meetings via telephone or computer with video/presentation capabilities. The document identifies the file as EFTA00029636.
On November 25, 2019, Marc Weinstein received an email from the Epstein estate regarding an accepted call. The email is attached as “unnamed” and dated November 25, 2019.

Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP is sending documents related to a subpoena regarding the Epstein estate to Andrew Tomback and others. He is providing advance notice of the documents' impending delivery and requesting a brief discussion. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP is preparing to send documents related to subpoenas from the Epstein estate to an individual identified as "[REDACTED]". He contacted Weinstein to provide a heads-up before sending the documents and offered a brief discussion. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York is sending contact information to Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback regarding subpoenas related to the Epstein estate. The attorney requests a meeting this Wednesday at 9:30 AM and encourages contact at any time, including over the weekend.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, Marc Weinstein (redacted) participated in a Skype meeting (Conference ID: 169 269 771) with the Epstein estate. The meeting was classified as X-PERSONAL and lasted from 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM GMT. The event was created on November 25, 2019.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein (REDACTED) regarding the Epstein estate. The meeting lasted from 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM GMT. The event was classified as X-PERSONAL.

On December 2, 2019, at 3:30 PM GMT, a Skype meeting titled “Epstein Estate Call” occurred, organized by Marc Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard &amp; Palmer. The meeting attendee was [REDACTED], and also included Tomback, Andrew of WhiteCase. The meeting utilized the dial-in number +1 (201) 630-0824 and conference ID 169269771. Additional dial-in numbers were provided for various countries including Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Singapore, United Kingdom, and United States. A reminder message was to be displayed 15 minutes before the start.

On December 30, 2019, a U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York (“USANYS”) received a follow-up email regarding discussions with attorneys for the Epstein estate’s trustees. The trustees requested a meeting with “=” and anyone she wished to include to discuss potential civil forfeiture claims. The attorneys expressed a desire to elevate the discussion and explain their belief that meaningful resolution, including involving victims, was in everyone’s interest. The U.S. Attorney requested confirmation from “=” regarding a meeting and asked for a response to relay to the trustees.

An email chain discusses a sharing order application related to documents from the Epstein estate, including trust and will documents. One participant, (USANYS), notes the absence of revocations in the document and suggests adding that term if intended. Another participant, [REDACTED], updated the application describing the received materials and requests a review to ensure accuracy. The email chain references document ID EFTA00022990.

Sigrid McCawley from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP received a communication regarding a $621,000 bill submitted by Maxwell’s lawyers (Haddon Morgan) to the Epstein Estate in the USVI. The bill relates to payments Maxwell previously denied making in connection with her or any litigation. The communication included a PDF attachment labeled “EFTA00021064” and a “DS First Quarterly Account.pdf”.

Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, sent an email detailing a $621,000 bill submitted by Maxwell’s lawyers (Haddon Morgan) to the Epstein Estate in the USVI. This bill was submitted despite Maxwell’s prior testimony stating she wasn’t paying for related expenses or litigation. The email attached a PDF document containing this information.

On March 13, 2020, Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) received emails regarding an investigation into the Jeffrey Epstein Estate and Southern Country International Bank in the US Virgin Islands. An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the District of the Virgin Islands initiated contact to coordinate with Berman’s office, requesting a point of contact within the SDNY unit. The USVI team, comprised of FBI and IRS-CI, was conducting an investigation, seeking to avoid interference with any existing investigations. Berman responded, suggesting coordination through contacting the VI-USAO Senior Litigation Counsel.  A follow-up email on March 4th reiterated the need for coordination and a designated contact person.

Brad Edwards sent a complaint filed by Doe versus the Epstein estate, identified as “doc 001 Doe vs Epstein estate complaint.pdf,” to [REDACTED]. The email included the complaint document and a text file (ATT00001.txt).
A document titled “doc 001 Doe vs Epstein estate complaint.pdf” was sent by Brad Edwards to [REDACTED] on March 23, 2020, containing the file EFTA00011364.

Virgin Islands. *   The investigation includes examining Epstein’s jail calls and custodial materials, potentially issued through grand jury subpoenas. *   Communication occurs between Nate (Assistant U.S. Attorney, District of the Virgin Islands) and Geoffrey Berman (USANYS) to coordinate efforts and identify a contact person within Sony. *   The FBI and IRS-CI are also participating in the investigation. *   The initial inquiry was prompted by a USVI-based FBI and IRS-CI team opening an investigation into the estate and bank.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] (USAVI) to '=111S' and Matthew Maier (USANYS) regarding the Jeffrey Epstein Estate, Southern Country International Bank, and USVI. The email included a reference to EFTA00030815 and provided contact information including a toll-free number and passcode.
An email was sent from “USANYS” to “USAVI” on April 2, 2020, regarding the accepted status of the Jeffrey Epstein Estate, Southern Country International Bank, and USVI (EFTA00028349).

On April 3, 2020, a Conference Line Call-In event occurred involving the Jeffrey Epstein Estate and Southern Country International Bank/USVI. The event lasted from 15:00:00 to 16:00:00 and was classified as X-PERSONAL. The attendee was [REDACTED].

On April 3, 2020, at 3:00 PM GMT, a call-in conference was scheduled involving the Jeffrey Epstein Estate, Southern Country International Bank, and the US Virgin Islands (USVI). The event, designated as “X-PERSONAL,” was organized by (USAVI) and (USANYS), with a toll-free number (866-421-2611) and passcode (1950230#) for access. A reminder message was to be displayed 4 hours prior to the start.

On April 15, 2020, Kate L. Doniger (Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP) contacted [REDACTED] (USANYS) regarding a request for information related to Jeffrey Epstein.  Alexandra Conlon, also representing Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, responded on February 25, 2020, sending a Touhy letter and supporting exhibit to the Department of Justice requesting documents related to the ongoing litigation against the Epstein estate.  AUSA [REDACTED] (USANYS) sent a letter on January 6, 2020, acknowledging receipt of the request and offering to discuss it.  Doniger indicated she did not require further information at that time, anticipating an update early the following week.

The New York Times published an article on April 27, 2020, titled “Attorney General Sees Too Much Secrecy in Epstein Estate.” The article reported that the Attorney General was concerned about excessive secrecy surrounding the management and finances of Jeffrey Epstein’s estate.

The provided document consists of email exchanges related to a legal matter concerning the sharing of documents related to the Epstein estate. Key points include: *   Multiple individuals (identified only by "[REDACTED]") are involved in reviewing and updating a sharing order. *   The order pertains to sharing trust agreements and wills, specifically referencing “Trust II” and a “2019 Trust.” *   There are discussions about referencing the Trust II documents, clarifying whether they should be included, and correcting typos within the order and accompanying application. *   There's a request to determine the appropriate docket number for the order and to ensure the shared materials accurately reflect the received documents. *   A delay in finalizing the order is noted, with an apology for the delay and a plan to revisit the matter with El and MI. *   The sender repeatedly asks for a review and confirmation of the updated sharing order application.

The core issue revolves around securing a formal interview with the witness, facilitated through the Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) between the US and the UK. Concerns center on ensuring confidentiality and limiting the use of any information obtained during the interview. Key points include: *   **Treaty Language:** The USANYS seeks to adhere to the treaty language, particularly Article 7, regarding confidentiality and permitted uses of information. *   **Proposed Language:** Initial draft language for a confidentiality agreement is proposed, emphasizing limitations on disclosure beyond criminal investigations and court orders. *   **UK Concerns:** The UK’s involvement highlights the potential for conditions on evidence provided under the MLAT. *   **Civil Litigation Risk:** There’s concern that the witness could pursue civil action related to the Epstein estate, prompting efforts to broaden the confidentiality scope. *   **Negotiations:** Several rounds of email exchanges occur, with the USANYS proposing and revising confidentiality terms to address concerns from the UK and the witness’s solicitors. A final agreement is reached, focusing on limiting public statements and disclosure of information for a defined period.

On July 6, 2020, two individuals, [REDACTED] and [REDACTED], discussed trust-related matters concerning the Epstein estate. [REDACTED] informed [REDACTED] that [REDACTED] was handling CIDs and that [REDACTED] was considering a departure date of July 20th. There was a planned call on July 7th to discuss these matters. [REDACTED] had previously been handling trust issues before taking leave, and expressed a desire to consult with [REDACTED] during their remaining two weeks.

An email chain discusses a call regarding the "Epstein estate." A Hu hes Hubbard & Reed LLP attorney proposes a call for July 8, 2020, at 1:00 PM with multiple recipients, including [REDACTED] and [REDACTED]. The email includes standard legal disclaimers regarding confidential information and email transmission security.

On July 8, 2020, at 1:00 PM GMT, individuals from Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP (specifically, an “I Partner” and Chair of White Collar Defense) were scheduled to participate in a call regarding the Epstein estate. The call was initiated by an unknown sender and intended for recipients listed as [REDACTED]. The email contains a standard confidentiality disclaimer.

An email chain discusses the Epstein estate. One email proposes a call for 1:00 on July 8, 2020, and another responds affirmatively, stating “this works for me, and the more the merrier.” The emails are sent between individuals associated with Hubbard & Reed LLP and reference the estate.

Marc Weinstein of Hu hes Hubbard & Reed LLP is requesting a call with the recipient around 1:00 PM on July 8, 2020, regarding the Epstein estate. The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers.

Audrey Strauss, a U.S. Attorney, sent draft comments to the Epstein estate trustees' counsel regarding a letter addressing issues related to the 1953 Trust Agreement. The letter included a question about a waiver of attorney-client privilege for the trustees’ discovery review. The Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York initially drafted the letter.

On July 25, 2020, correspondence occurred regarding a letter to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein’s estate. A draft letter was attached, including a question about a waiver of attorney-client privilege related to discovery review. On July 23, 2020, an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent a draft letter to the estate trustees, detailing the purpose and requesting review.

Marc A. Weinstein of Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP sent an email to “Mrs’” (likely a recipient’s name) on November 9, 2020, requesting a call to provide an update regarding the Epstein Estate. The email included a standard confidentiality warning regarding the transmission of the message.
An email was sent from "Weinstein" to Marc Weinstein on November 9, 2020, regarding the acceptance of the Epstein Estate (EFTA00028118). An unnamed attachment was included.

On November 9, 2020, at 21:30:00 UTC, a Skype meeting occurred with Marc Weinstein and the Epstein Estate. The meeting, identified by Conference ID 570 579 045, was classified as X-PERSONAL. The meeting was created on November 9, 2020, at 16:22:32 UTC and remains unchanged.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to Marc Weinstein on November 9, 2020, regarding an update on the Epstein Estate. Andrew Tomback is copied, and the email is associated with the "USAHUB-USAJouma1111" alias. The email is labeled as a reply to an update titled “Epstein Estate update.”

The email included a forwarded message from Weinstein to Andrew Tomback regarding a request for a call to discuss a new development related to the estate. On December 1, 2020, an inquiry was raised regarding assaults occurring at Great St Jim LLC, formerly known as Great St James Island. The island was acquired on January 18th and January 21st, 2016, by Great St Jim LLC, potentially linked to the Epstein estate.

Marc Weinstein proposes a call this afternoon, but [REDACTED] suggests postponing it to the following day to allow for more review time. An email chain discusses a call regarding the Epstein Estate update. Marc A. Weinstein requests a call to provide an update, proposing options for the call’s timing and leadership. Another individual expresses willingness to join the call, stating they will continue reviewing images. A standard confidentiality disclaimer is included within the email.

An email chain discusses a subpoena request for private video recordings from the Jeffrey Epstein estate. One individual is following up on the estate’s compliance with the subpoena, noting difficulty remembering the status. A link to an article regarding the recordings is included in the initial email.

An email exchange discusses the status of the Jeffrey Epstein estate’s compliance with a subpoena for private video recordings from his properties. One party is struggling to recall details regarding the situation, while another party sent a link to an article regarding the recordings. The email thread involves individuals named [REDACTED].

Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Ghislaine Maxwell, alleging sexual assault, battery, emotional distress, and false imprisonment. *   **Dismissal Motion:** Doe moved to dismiss the case under Rule 41(a)(2) of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, citing the ongoing criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. *   **Criminal Prosecution:** Maxwell is being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York for related criminal charges (ECF No. 20-CR-330). *   **Victims’ Compensation Program:** The Epstein Estate established a compensation program for victims, and Doe accepted an offer, requiring dismissal with prejudice. *   **Stipulation and Conditions:** To achieve dismissal, Doe sought to have the case dismissed with prejudice under the terms of a partially executed stipulation. However, Maxwell objected and proposed additional conditions regarding attorney’s fees, costs, and access to the release agreement. *   **Maxwell’s Objections:** Maxwell argued that the stipulation regarding fees and costs was problematic and that she should be allowed to seek fees as the prevailing party and to sue for abuse of process. She also requested a copy of the unredacted release agreement. *   **Court’s Order:** The Court granted the motion to dismiss with prejudice, subject to the proposed conditions – modification of the fee and cost provision, allowing Maxwell to seek fees as the prevailing party, and providing her with the unredacted release. The parties were given until March 19, 2021, to indicate their agreement.

The Epstein Victims’ Compensation Program (Epstein VCP) has been established to compensate individuals who were sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and the Epstein Estate. It is a voluntary, confidential, and independent claims resolution program designed by Kenneth R. Feinberg, Camille S. Biros, and Jordana ("Jordy") H. Feldman. The Administrator, Jordy Feldman, will determine individual claimant eligibility and compensation, operating independently of the Epstein Estate. Key features include a streamlined, cost-effective process with relaxed evidentiary requirements, a voluntary participation model, and strict confidentiality protocols. The claims filing period runs through March 25, 2021.

This email details a tentative phone call between individuals identified as Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (representing the Epstein estate) on March 31, 2021, regarding EFTA00032446. No attachments were included.
An email was sent from "USANYS" to " " regarding a call with Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate) on March 31, 2021. The email is attached as EFTA00018019.

On April 5, 2021, a call occurred between Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate) from 7:30 PM to 8:00 PM. The call was marked as X-PERSONAL and created on March 31, 2021. One attendee is redacted.
A tentative call was scheduled for 2021-04-05 19:30:00 - 20:00:00 +0000 with Andy Tomback and Marc Weinstein (Epstein estate). The call was classified as X-PERSONAL. One attendee is redacted.

Daniel Ruzumna, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, contacted Special Agent Ruzumna at the FBI New York Field Office regarding a potential discovery of child pornography within approximately 1,100 videos recovered from Epstein’s emails.  The estate was responding to document production requests related to settlements and subpoenas. During a review, a video surfaced containing potentially illegal content, prompting the immediate halt of the review.  The estate contacted the FBI and acknowledged the involvement of co-counsel from Hughes Hubbard & Reed, seeking guidance and confirming protocols were in place to protect reviewers. The video’s origin involved a convicted child pornography offender and two topless women. The documents involved the processing of the videos by a document collection vendor without review.

An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office contacted Daniel Ruzumna regarding a potential discovery of Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM) related to the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein. Ruzumna, representing one of the co-executors of the estate alongside Hughes Hubbard & Reed, was reviewing approximately 1,100 videos pulled from Epstein’s emails and files. During a review, a video surfaced potentially containing child pornography, linked to a convicted child pornography offender and topless women.  Due to this, the review was halted, and Ruzumna requested guidance from the FBI. The video was processed by a document collection vendor without review, and no downloads occurred to law firm servers.

A lawyer (Daniel Ruzumna) from Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP is communicating with an FBI Special Agent (Young) regarding the review of approximately 1,100 videos recovered from Jeffrey Epstein’s emails. The Estate of Jeffrey Epstein is responding to document requests related to settlements and subpoenas. During the review, a video surfaced potentially containing child pornography, prompting a halt and communication with co-counsel (Dan Weiner and Hilary McDonnell) at Hughes Hubbard & Reed. The documents were processed by a vendor and not downloaded to firm servers. The communication seeks guidance from the FBI.

*   The review is prompted by a potential discovery of child pornography within the videos. *   A video containing topless women was identified by Hughes Hubbard & Reed co-counsel, linked to an individual convicted of child pornography offenses. *   The review was halted, and contact was made with the FBI New York Field Office. *   The estate is responding to document requests related to settlements and subpoenas. *   The videos were processed by a document collection vendor without full review.

Daniel Ruzumna, representing the co-executors of the Jeffrey Epstein Estate, is reviewing approximately 1,100 videos for potential child pornography. The review was initiated due to requests for documents related to settlements and subpoenas. During the review, a video surfaced featuring topless women shared by an individual convicted of child pornography offenses.  The review was halted, and the team contacted authorities. The Estate is processing the videos through a document collection vendor without downloading them to firm servers.  Hughes Hubbard & Reed co-counsel, Dan Weiner and Hilary McDonnell, are aware of the situation and can clarify details.

*   **Discovery of Potentially Child Pornographic Video:** During a review of approximately 1,100 videos, a video containing a convicted child pornography offender and topless women was identified. *   **Protocol Established:** A protocol was established with involved parties to protect reviewers during the document review process. *   **Suspension of Review & Request for Guidance:** The review was halted, and Ruzumna requests guidance from the FBI regarding the potentially sensitive material. *   **Data Handling Concerns:** Ruzumna expresses concerns about the processing of the videos by a third-party vendor and the lack of downloads to firm servers. *   **Legal Representation:** Both Ruzumna and McDonnell represent co-executors of the estate, with McDonnell’s firm providing legal support in related litigation.

Hilary McDonnell (Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP) scheduled a meeting with Daniel Ruzumna (Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP) regarding the Epstein Estate and a potential discovery of child pornography within 1,100 videos. Ruzumna contacted the FBI New York Field Office after a video surfaced during a review, potentially containing CSAM and referencing a prior conviction for a similar offense. The Estate’s co-executors were reviewing the videos as part of document production obligations related to settlements and litigation. A protocol was established with involved parties for handling potentially illegal material. The review was halted, and Ruzumna requested guidance from the FBI. The communication involved multiple individuals including FBI Special Agents, attorneys from Hughes Hubbard & Reed, and other legal counsel.

Hilary McDonnell, an associate at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, is coordinating with the FBI regarding the review of videos from the Epstein Estate for potential Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM). The review involves approximately 1,100 videos pulled from Epstein’s emails and files. McDonnell is scheduling meetings with FBI Special Agent Daniel Ruzumna and his team at Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP to discuss the findings. A video flagged as potentially containing CSAM was identified, leading to a temporary halt in the review process. The involved parties are communicating through email, detailing the process, concerns about potential illegal content, and requesting guidance from the FBI. The correspondence also mentions a previously approved protocol with the SDNY court regarding the video review.

This document is a General Release executed by a Jeffrey Epstein victim (the Claimant) in exchange for a compensation offer from the Epstein Victims Compensation Program (EVCP). The release covers claims arising from alleged sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein against the Epstein Estate, Co-Executors, Co-Trustees, and affiliated entities. It includes a broad waiver of claims, acknowledging potential claims revival statutes and addressing potential Medicare/Medicaid lien claims through a third-party administrator (Epiq). The release explicitly states that the claimant acknowledges the California Civil Code Section 1542 regarding releases and waives any unknown or unsuspected claims. It also includes a confidentiality clause regarding the EVCP program.

An individual (identified as EFTA00019312) inquired about the status of a subpoena related to the Epstein estate’s images and videos, specifically concerning a request made during a transition off the case. The individual was unable to locate the subpoena within past subpoenas and sought information from the sender regarding its whereabouts.

An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York forwarded a communication regarding discussions with trustees of the Jeffrey Epstein estate. The trustees requested a meeting with a specific individual (“=”) to discuss potential civil forfeiture claims and a proposed fund resolution, believing it would benefit all parties, including the victims. The Assistant U.S. Attorney was tasked with ascertaining whether “=” would agree to the meeting and relaying the response.

U.S. Attorneys are facilitating communication between Epstein estate trustees and an individual (“=11,11YS) regarding potential civil forfeiture claims. The trustees seek a meeting to discuss a proposed fund and a resolution with the government, including potential discussions with victims. The Assistant U.S. Attorney is requesting confirmation from the recipient (“=11,11YS) if she is willing to meet with the trustees and anticipates a meeting after the holidays.

An email exchange concerning the Jeffrey Epstein Estate’s obligation to share private videos recorded at his properties. The email originates from the US Department of Justice and includes recipients at the EFTA00019287 account and the USAHUB-USAJournal111 address. A message with the subject “Jeffrey_Epstein_Estate_Must_Share_Private_Videos_Recorded_At_His_Properties” is attached.

The Marsh Law Firm and Client agree that the Firm will provide legal services to the Client regarding claims arising from allegations of sexual abuse involving Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and others connected to their sex trafficking operation, specifically targeting the FBI, Department of Justice, and relevant government entities. These claims encompass criminal, civil, and other causes of action related to the claims and also cover legal issues surrounding the Client’s images and any associated child sex abuse material. The Firm will conduct investigations, draft legal pleadings, and pursue settlement efforts, including restitution requests, if applicable. The Client has not retained other attorneys for these specific claims, and prior counsel’s work on the Epstein estate and JP Morgan/Deutsche Bank matters does not apply.

A U.S. Attorney’s Office (Southern District of New York) is communicating with attorneys representing the trustees of the Epstein estate regarding potential civil forfeiture claims. The trustees requested a meeting with a specific individual (“=”) to discuss resolving the claims and a proposed fund, believing meaningful discussions would benefit all parties, including victims. The Assistant U.S. Attorney is requesting confirmation from the recipient (“MIMIMIE”) if “=” is willing to meet with the trustees and is awaiting a response.

A correspondence discusses the legal obligation for the Jeffrey Epstein estate to share private videos recorded at his properties, specifically referencing an article from *OLCMagazine* about Darren Indyke and video recordings. The email originates from an unknown sender to an unknown recipient and includes a link to the article.
